intro: Lucuma sphaerocarpa, commonly known as the golden apple, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its distinctive golden-yellow, sweet-tasting fruit. The fruit is typically harvested when it reaches maturity, which is indicated by its change in color and texture. The plant thrives in high-altitude environments with well-drained soil and a cool climate. Its botanical features include evergreen leaves and a shrub-like growth habit.
